First aid information?: If in eyes: Hold eye open and rinse slowly and gently with water for 15 -20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye. Call a poison control center or doctor for treatment advice. If swallowed: Call a poison control center or doctor immediately for treatment advice. Have person sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. Do not give anything by mouth to an unconscious person.
How, where, and on what crop should I us: Hold container 4 to 6 inches from skin or clothing and spray. Do not apply over cuts, wounds, irritated or sunburned skin. Do not spray in enclosed areas. Use just enough repellent to cover exposed skin and/or clothing. Avoid over-application of this product. Frequent reapplication and saturation are unnecessary. Do not allow children to handle this product. Do not apply to children's hands. When using on children, apply to your own hands and then put it on the child. After returning indoors, wash treated skin with soap and water. Spread evenly with hands to moisten all exposed skin.
How does the product have to be stored o: Store away from heat or flame in an area inaccessible to children. Nonrefillable container. Before disposing, empty the container by using the product according to the label. Do not reuse or refill this container. Place in trash or offer for recycling if available. If partially filled: Call your local solid waste agency or 1 -800-529-3394 for disposal instructions. Never place unused product down any indoor or outdoor drain.
